CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 14, 1953, pg, 23, reads: "HURRICANE - Pittsburghers and out-of-towners alike flocked to the grand opening Monday of the new Hurricane Club at 1603 Centre Avenue. This Exquisite addition to Pittsburgh's night spots lays claim to being one of the most modern restaurant - bars for many miles around...At the far right is a section of the Hurricane's opening night crowd with the Myrtle Young Trio (top center of pic) playing nightly.  'Birdie' and 'Shine' Dunlap, proprietors of the Hurricane, can also be seen supervising their 'opening night.' - Harris Photo."Birdie was known for packing people into the booths so as to fit as many people as possible inside.
TitMainTitle: Crowd in opening night of Hurricane Club including Shine Dunlap on left wearing dark bow tie at bar, Gertie next to him wearing scarf around neck, Red in left foreground, and Anna Simmons "Birdie" Dunlap wearing light suit in foreground, with Ruby Young Trio performing in background
